dreisoft.tresos.generator.ng.api.cds

Class CDSGenFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • dreisoft.tresos.generator.ng.api.cds.CDSGenFile

  • public final class CDSGenFile
extends java.lang.Object
    Virtual file for the CDS generator. The CDSGenFile provides methods to write CDS data.
    Since:
    2008.b
    See Also:
    startScope(), startScope(dreisoft.tresos.generator.ng.api.cds.CDSGenScope.Attribute), startScope(dreisoft.tresos.generator.ng.api.cds.CDSGenScope.Attribute[]), endScope(), type(CType),

    Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

    • Method Detail

      • getWriter

        public GeneratorWriter getWriter()
        Return the writer of this cds file.
        Returns:
        A GeneratorWriter, never null.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • getScope

        public CDSGenScope getScope()
        Returns the open scope. If no scope has been started yet it will start a default scope.
        Returns:
        The open scope, never null.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • startScope

        public CDSGenScope startScope()
                       throws CDSGenAPIException
        Starts a default scope. If this CDSGenFile contains default scope attributes, then these attributes are assigned to the new scope. Note that you can't start a new scope if there is still another active.
        Returns:
        The started scope, never null.
        Throws:
        CDSGenAPIException - if another scope is already active
        Since:
        2008.b

      • startScope

        public CDSGenScope startScope(CDSGenScope.Attribute scopeAttrib)
                       throws CDSGenAPIException
        Starts a new scope with the given attribute. If this CDSGenFile contains default scope attributes, then these attributes are merged together with the given attribute. If a default attribute with the same type of the given attribute exists then it will be overwritten with the given one only for the new scope. Note that you can't start a new scope if there is still another active.
        Parameters:
        scopeAttrib - Attribute for the new scope, can be null.
        Returns:
        The started scope, never null.
        Throws:
        CDSGenAPIException - if another scope is already active
        Since:
        2008.b

      • startScope

        public CDSGenScope startScope(CDSGenScope.Attribute[] scopeAttribs)
                       throws CDSGenAPIException
        Starts a new scope with the given attributes. If this CDSGenFile contains default scope attributes, then these attributes are merged together with the given attributes. If a default attribute with the same type of one of the given attributes exists then it will be overwritten with the given one only for the new scope. Note that you can't start a new scope if there is still another active.
        Parameters:
        scopeAttribs - Attributes for the new scope, can be null.
        Returns:
        The started scope, never null.
        Throws:
        CDSGenAPIException - if another scope is already active
        Since:
        2008.b

      • endScope

        public void endScope()
        Closes the scope. If no scope is active then nothing happens.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • hasTypeDef

        public boolean hasTypeDef(java.lang.Class<? extends CType> clazz)
        Determines whether the given CType class has already been defined within this file.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class to check.
        Returns:
        true if the given class has already been defined.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • type

        public void type(CType var)
        Generates type definition for the given variable. If the variable extends or references other types that are not defined yet then these types are assumed to be defined elsewhere. If you want the engine to automatically generate typedefs of extended or references types then use method type(CType, boolean) and say true there. If no scope is currently active, a default scope will be started first.
        Parameters:
        var - The CType instance to write, nothing is generated if null is passed as value.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • type

        public void type(CType var,
                 boolean considerReferences)
        Generates type definition for the given variable. If considerReferences is true then every reference or superclass of the given variable (that has not been defined yet) will be generated first. If no scope is currently active, a default scope will be started first.
        Parameters:
        var - The CType instance to write, nothing is generated if null is passed as value.
        considerReferences - If it's true then every reference or superclass of the given variable (that has not been defined yet) will be generated first, otherwise only the given variable will be generated.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • var

        public void var(CType var)
        Generates variable definition for the given variable. If no scope is currently active, a default scope will be started first.
        Parameters:
        var - The CType instance to write, nothing is generated if null is passed as value.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • typedIdentifier

        public void typedIdentifier(CType var)
        Generates typed identifier for the given variable. If no scope is currently active, a default scope will be started first.
        Parameters:
        var - The CType instance to write, nothing is generated if null is passed as value.
        Since:
        13.0

      • initializer

        public void initializer(CType var,
                        java.lang.String lineTerm)
        Generates initializer for the given variable. If no scope is currently active, a default scope will be started first.
        Parameters:
        var - The CType instance to write, nothing is generated if null is passed as value.
        lineTerm - A string that is appended to each generated line prior to the newline character
        Since:
        13.0

      • initializer

        public void initializer(CType var)
        Generates initializer for the given variable. If no scope is currently active, a default scope will be started first.
        Parameters:
        var - The CType instance to write, nothing is generated if null is passed as value.
        Since:
        13.0

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the file. If it is closed then it's not possible to write to the file anymore. Normally you do not call this method directly, call CDSGenEngine.endFile(CDSGenFile) instead.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Determines whether this file has been closed.
        Returns:
        true if the file is closed.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • attachCompilerAbstraction

        public void attachCompilerAbstraction(java.lang.Class<? extends CType> clazz,
                                      CompilerAbstraction ca)
                               throws CDSGenAPIException
        Attaches the given compiler abstraction to the given ctype class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - A CType class.
        ca - Compiler abstraction that is now known for each instance of the given class, can be null.
        Throws:
        CDSGenAPIException - if a compiler abstraction has already been assigned to the given class
        Since:
        2008.b

      • getAttachedCompilerAbstraction

        public CompilerAbstraction getAttachedCompilerAbstraction(java.lang.Class<? extends CType> clazz)
        Returns the compiler abstraction attached to the given class. Note that null can mean that the given class uses no compiler abstraction or a compiler abstraction has not yet been attached. To check this call method isAttachedCompilerAbstraction(Class).
        Parameters:
        clazz - A CType class.
        Returns:
        Compiler abstraction, can be null.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • isAttachedCompilerAbstraction

        public boolean isAttachedCompilerAbstraction(java.lang.Class<? extends CType> clazz)
        Determines whether a compiler abstraction has been attached to the given class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - A CType class.
        Returns:
        true if there is a compiler abstraction attached to the given class.
        Since:
        2008.b
